We had a lovely stay at the cottage. The space is much nicer than the pictures can show. It was airy and comfortable. The master suite upstairs has a wonderful balcony, which was perfect for watching the stunning sunsets and viewing the Milky Way overhead on a clear night. Kimberly was wonderful, and her relatives are nearby (with their adorable dogs) if you need anything. The house had everything we needed.
It is a great, private spot to relax by the water, but it's also in a great location for seeing the North Country. We went as far as Alexandria Bay in one direction and the Eisenhower Dam in Massena in the other. A few notes about touring: there are several Amish communities nearby, so you will see buggies on the roads and in parking lots. There is a nice general store in Heuvelton that sells a lot of Amish crafts. Also, check out Mares Wares on Route 37. Marianne sells locals artists' work, as well as her own pottery. If you are lucky, you can sign up for a lesson! Of course, the Remington Museum in Ogdensburg is remarkable. The whole area is quite rural, so be prepared for long stretches of farmland and tiny little towns.
All in all, we had a wonderful time. Thank you!
